sub_title: Senior Engineering Manager | Looking for a new challenge, Available immediately
summary:
Looking for a (senior) Engineering Manager role with a balance between technical leadership and people leadership responsibilities. However, I am not interested in roles where I am expected to be writing code or to be highly involved in day to day topics. Open to full time internal positions, or to join in a temporary role as self-employed professional (ZZP).

I am a Dutch-Egyptian Senior Engineering Manager, with a background as a software engineer. Currently working at Bol.com until end of June. I have 5 years experience working as a manager of software teams.

Before working as an Engineering Manager, I worked as a Software Engineer for 6 years, with focus on computer vision, which is also the field of my Master's degree. My experience includes working at Microsoft research (Egypt), University of Strasbourg (France), Cairo University (Egypt), Nile University (Egypt), and Navinfo Europe (Netherlands).

I worked on "Surgical workflow detection in Cholecystectomy videos". In our work we adjusted and finetuned AlexNet architecture to multi-task learn the used surgical tools and subsequently the current phase in the surgery (which partly depend on the used tools). We presented the first method to do the "Surgical workflow detection" using only visual features and also the first method using a convNet.

The group works on advanced Multimedia Information Retrieval technologies for transfer into Microsoft products. I received two "technology transfer awards" for my work transferring technologies to Microsoft's product groups. Main programming language used was C++, but I worked also with C# and Python.

My work tackled many areas, including:
 • General object detection.
 ‌• Instance level object recognition using RGB-D data.
 • Using deep learning for object recognition.
 • Using text as an additional cue for image classification.

Throughout my work I was the mentor for two summer interns and a co-mentor for a third intern, they worked on the following areas:
 • Instance level object recognition using RGB data.
 • Enhancing the learning process of a certain object detection technique using semi-supervised learning.
 • Developing a version of a classifier to run on mobile phones.

I participated in the process of short-listing the candidate graduation projects for sponsorship according to their projects proposals, and i was a member in the panel judging the teams' presentation and then choosing the final list of sponsored projects.

I participated in the process of choosing summer interns. My duties included participating in preparing initial screening coding exam, scoring the candidates CVs, and conducting interviews for some of the short-listed candidates.

I represented Microsoft as a judge for "Multimedia Understanding track" in IbTIECar 2014 competition.', 'title': 'Software Engineer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1035, 'name': 'Microsoft, Cairo Innovation Center', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE88xCsONDULQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1618231291419?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=gohrejCATVB1ukPwpEYzd2garcSVcEoHmQjS3W-NJk8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/microsoft/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Egypt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Microsoft', 'description': 'Worked in researching state-of-the-art image denoisers, comparing their results and then implementing one of them that was best suited for the project’s requirements.
